1{-# LANGUAGE ScopedTypeVariables #-}
2{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
3
4module Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Nest.Confl
5  ( 
6    -- * copy
7    consCopy,
8    -- $CopyExample
9  
10    -- * for
11    consFor, relmapFor, relkitFor,
12    -- $ForExample
13  
14    -- * group
15    consGroup, relmapGroup, relkitGroup,
16    -- $GroupExample
17  
18    -- * slice
19    consSlice, relmapSlice, relkitSlice,
20    -- $SliceExample
21  
22    -- * slice-up
23    consSliceUp, relmapSliceUp, relkitSliceUp,
24  ) where
25
26import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base              as B
27import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax            as S
28import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Data              as D
29import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Core              as C
30import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Base          as Op
31import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Flat          as Op
32import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Nest.Flow     as Op
33import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Flat.Message  as Msg
34
35
36-- ----------------------  copy
37
38-- $CopyExample
39--
40--  Equivalent operation for @down@ @\/r@.
41--
42--    > copy r ( dee | slice /r r )
43
44consCopy :: C.RopCons c
45consCopy med =
46  do n    <- Op.getWord   med "-var"
47     rmap <- Op.getRelmap med "-relmap"
48     Right $ C.relmapCopy med n rmap
49
50
51
52-- ----------------------  for
53
54-- $ForExample
55--
56--  Remove term @\/c@ from a nested relation in term @\/r@.
57--
58--    > for /r ( cut /c )
59
60consFor :: (D.CRel c) => C.RopCons c
61consFor med =
62    do n    <- Op.getTerm   med "-term"
63       rmap <- Op.getRelmap med "-relmap"
64       Right $ relmapFor med n rmap
65
66relmapFor :: (D.CRel c) => C.Intmed c -> S.TermName -> B.Map (C.Relmap c)
67relmapFor med n rmap = relmapForInner med n (Op.relmapUp med n B.<> rmap)
68
69relmapForInner :: (D.CRel c) => C.Intmed c -> S.TermName -> B.Map (C.Relmap c)
70relmapForInner med n = C.relmapNest med . bin where
71    bin = C.relmapBinary med $ relkitFor n
72
73relkitFor :: forall c. (D.CRel c) => S.TermName -> C.RelkitBinary c
74relkitFor n (C.Relkit _ (Just he2) kitb2) (Just he1) = Right kit3 where
75    lr    = D.shareSide [n] he1
76    side  = D.ssRSide lr
77    he3   = D.headConsNest n he2 $ D.headMap side he1
78    kit3  = C.relkitJust he3 $ C.RelkitOneToAbOne False kitf3 [kitb2]
79
80    kitf3 :: [C.BodyMap c] -> B.AbMap [c]
81    kitf3 bmaps cs1 =
82        do let [bmap2] = bmaps
83           bo2 <- bmap2 [cs1]
84           Right $ D.pRel (D.Rel he2 bo2) : side cs1
85
86relkitFor _ _ _ = Right C.relkitNothing
87
88
89
90-- ----------------------  group
91
92-- $GroupExample
93--
94--  Split relation from @b@ by relation from @a@.
95--  In other words, group @b@ by @a@.
96--  Result relations are nested in term @\/r@.
97--
98--    > a | group b -to /r
99
100consGroup :: (Ord c, D.CRel c) => C.RopCons c
101consGroup med =
102  do rmap <- Op.getRelmap med "-relmap"
103     n    <- Op.getTerm   med "-to"
104     sh   <- Op.getMaybe Op.getTerms med "-share"
105     Right $ relmapGroup med sh n rmap
106
107relmapGroup :: (Ord c, D.CRel c) => C.Intmed c -> Op.SharedTerms -> S.TermName -> B.Map (C.Relmap c)
108relmapGroup med sh = C.relmapBinary med . relkitGroup sh
109
110relkitGroup :: forall c. (Ord c, D.CRel c) => Op.SharedTerms -> S.TermName -> C.RelkitBinary c
111relkitGroup sh n (C.Relkit _ (Just he2) kitb2) (Just he1) = kit3 where
112    lr      = D.shareSide he1 he2
113    toMap2  = B.gatherToMap . map (D.ssRAssoc lr)
114    he3     = D.headConsNest n he2 he1
115    kit3    = case Op.unmatchShare sh lr of
116                Nothing     -> Right $ C.relkitJust he3 $ C.RelkitAbFull False kitf3 [kitb2]
117                Just (e, a) -> Msg.unmatchShare e a
118
119    kitf3 bmaps bo1 =
120        do let [bmap2] = bmaps
121           bo2  <- bmap2 bo1
122           let map2 = toMap2 bo2
123           Right $ map (add map2) bo1
124
125    add map2 cs1 =
126        let b2maybe = B.lookupMap (D.ssLShare lr cs1) map2
127            b2sub   = B.fromMaybe [] b2maybe
128        in D.pRel (D.Rel he2 b2sub) : cs1
129
130relkitGroup _ _ _ _ = Right C.relkitNothing
131
132
133
134-- ----------------------  slice
135
136-- $SliceExample
137--
138--  Add nested relation in term @\/p@.
139--
140--    > slice /p ( source P /a /b )
141--
142--  Add nested relation as meet of @\/p@ and @\/q@.
143--
144--    > slice /r ( ^/p | meet ^/q )
145--
146
147consSlice :: (D.CRel c) => C.RopCons c
148consSlice med =
149  do n    <- Op.getTerm   med "-term"
150     rmap <- Op.getOptRelmap C.relmapId med "-relmap"
151     Right $ relmapSlice med n rmap
152
153relmapSlice :: (D.CRel c) => C.Intmed c -> S.TermName -> B.Map (C.Relmap c)
154relmapSlice med n = C.relmapNest med . bin where
155    bin = C.relmapBinary med $ relkitSlice n
156
157relkitSlice :: (D.CRel c) => S.TermName -> C.RelkitBinary c
158relkitSlice n (C.Relkit _ (Just he2) kitb2) (Just he1) = Right kit3 where
159    he3   = D.headConsNest n he2 he1
160    kit3  = C.relkitJust he3 $ C.RelkitOneToAbOne False kitf3 [kitb2]
161    kitf3 bmaps cs1 =
162        do let [bmap2] = bmaps
163           bo2 <- bmap2 [cs1]
164           Right $ D.pRel (D.Rel he2 bo2) : cs1
165relkitSlice _ _ _ = Right C.relkitNothing
166
167
168-- ----------------------  slice-up
169
170consSliceUp :: (D.CRel c) => C.RopCons c
171consSliceUp med =
172  do rmap <- Op.getOptRelmap C.relmapId med "-relmap"
173     Right $ relmapSliceUp med rmap
174
175relmapSliceUp :: (D.CRel c) => C.Intmed c -> B.Map (C.Relmap c)
176relmapSliceUp med = C.relmapNest med . bin where
177    bin = C.relmapBinary med relkitSliceUp
178
179relkitSliceUp :: (D.CRel c) => C.RelkitBinary c
180relkitSliceUp (C.Relkit _ (Just he2) kitb2) _ = Right kit3 where
181    kit3  = C.relkitJust he2 $ C.RelkitOneToAbMany False kitf3 [kitb2]
182    kitf3 bmaps cs1 = do let [bmap2] = bmaps
183                         bmap2 [cs1]
184relkitSliceUp _ _ = Right C.relkitNothing
185
